result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas W. D'Lamatter

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cases called at 2:28 PM: 22CF852, 22CF859, 22CF860, 22CF872, 22CM381, 22CM439.
Defendant Thomas W. D'Lamatter in court with Attorney Michelle M Erdman.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Erdman requests time to discuss the offer with the Defendant.
Off record at 2:29 PM.
Case re-called at 2:36 PM.
Attorney Erdman requests the matters be set for trial. State requests until next week to determine which case they would like set for trial first.
State requests the Preliminary Hearings be waived or scheduled in 22CF852, 22CF859, 22CF860 based on the ARGN being held on 8/22/22.
Preliminary Hearing in 22CF852, 22CF859, 22CF860: 12/27/22 at 1:30 PM with 22CF872, 22CM381, 22CM439 to ride along.
Plea hearing on October 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:48 AM Cases called: 22CF852, 22CF859, 22CF860, 22CM381, 22CM439 & 22CF872. Defendant Thomas W. D'Lamatter in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Thomas W. D'Lamatter.  Attorney Robert Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF872: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas.  20 days to file motions. 

Defense has filed a Motion to Modify Bond in regards to the cash bond in 22CF872, even though all files were listed on the motion. State objects to bond modification but would be in favor of a lower cash amount. Court modifies bond to $1000 signature bond in 22CF872.

Plea Hearing: 10/28/22 at 2:30pm in person in all files.
Letter to Court by Defendant regarding bond modification

9:45 AM cases 22CM439, 22CF85922CF860, 22CM381, 22CF852 called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Thomas W. D'Lamatter in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Thomas W. D'Lamatter. Court enters not guilty pleas on behalf of the defendant.

Branch 2 for scheduling.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, No Such Number, Unable to Forward

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Comply with Sex Offender Registry.
(Covers 22CF852, 22CF859, 22CF860)

Cases called at 11:39 AM: 22CF852, 22CF859, 22CF860.
Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas W. D'Lamatter in court, in custody from the jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler.
Defendant waives reading of Complaint.  Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 8/10/22 at 2:30 PM.
RTN: 8/22/22 at 9:30 AM.
